author: Staff reports
title: Germantown wins shootout
text:
Lily Watson and Samantha Marrish scored in the shootout and goalkeeper Allysa Pasco stopped all four shootout shots as third-seeded Germantown nipped No. 6 Taconic Hills 2-1 in a Section II Class C field hockey quarterfinal-round game on Tuesday afternoon.
Ali Shumsky scored in the opening half to give the upstart Titans a 1-0 lead. But the homestanding Clippers cme back with 10 minutes left in regulation to tie the score on a goal by Lily Watson. Eliza Watson had an assist on the score.
Pasco finished with 10 saves and Taconic Hills goalie Hannah Waldorf stopped 16 shots.
More field hockey: Second-seeded Schuylerville blanked No. 7 Warrensburg 3-0 in another Class C quarterfinal-round test. Amanda Coleman , Kaitlyn Gunter and Alison Burnham each scored for the Black Horses, who got one save from Hunter VanArnum. Schuylerville will host Germantown at 3 p.m. Oct. 27 in a semifinal-round game. ... Fourth-seeded Greenwich got a pair of goals from Sabrina Whitehouse in a 3-0 Class C quarterfinal-round victory over No. 5 Glens Falls. The Witches will play at top-seeded Hoosick Falls, which defeated No. 8 North Warren, at 3 p.m. Oct. 27 in a semifinal-round game. ... The unbeaten Panthers, who are the two-time defending Class C champions, got a pair of goals from Liz Ryan in their 2-0 victory over North Warren, which finished the season at 8-8. Ally Burdick assisted on both goals for Hoosick Falls, now 17-0. Cassie Sherman had two saves for the Panthers and Morgan Yarosh stopped 10 shots for the Cougars.
Boys' cross country: Noah Valvo set a Schoharie school record by running in a time of 16:04 over the 3.1-mile course at Schoharie. He led Schoharie to Western Athletic Conference wins over Galway (23-32) and Cherry Valley (27-28).
Boys' volleyball: Bethlehem (14-0) stayed perfect in Suburban Council play by sweeping past Niskayuna by scores of 25-15, 25-9 and 25-19. Aaron Cook had 10 kills and three aces and Duncan Homer had 20 assists for the Eagles.
